content.description: Watch for loose blocks in the lower part of the crack. This is rated 8+ in Gillett's guideboo; however, I thought it was at least 5.10. Fist jam at the top, and exit with a yellow Alien at the top.
content.protection: A standard rack plus a yellow Alien and a #4 Camalot at the top.
content.location: This ascends a big dog leg crack with chockstones on the right side of the cliff.

content.description: Go up the right side of orange rock to an overhang clipping 2 bolts, stem to the base of the overhang, set a cam, and layback up to clip the bolt above overhand, then finish the left-facing lieback to a ledge. Enter a dihedral, and climb up until it is possible to reach right onto the arete and the finishing moves. Clip a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This ascends a dihedral on the left side of the cliff below a broken area with striking orange lichen.

content.description: Set a cam and clip a bolt under a small roof, lieback, stem, then mantel up clipping a brown bolt then a fixed pin. Clip a bolt on the face, and go directly left to a crack. Although the overhand lieback is the crux, the crack at the end should not be taken lightly.
content.protection: 4 bolts + a medium cam for the start.
content.location: Do an overhanging start to a slab on the right side of the cliff.

pathTokens: South Fork of St. Vrain Canyon
